__e: Well, ask him about him and Sally. Maybe it runs deeper than a one-off.
Ask him to tell him what he told me... about the devil.
He's looking for that guy, he'll get the photo for you.
Then call my husband, ask him to meet me for dinner at that place I went to with Massimo.
Ask him if he knows this guy or anything about his dad's business.
Ask Ray what happens to your village, ask him what happens to your daughter and your granddaughter, and tell me you'll choose history over your own family.
If he is quiet for even a second... Ask him what's wrong.
Go to the Governor, tell him my father refuses to leave and ask him what can be done for us, for how many days will we still be safe here?
- Tell him you're sorry for what you did.
You know what, apologize to him, really, for me.
Yeah, if you see him later, just apologize for me, okay?
Give him a second, and then go over there and... ask him how he is.
All right, well, if you see him around, ask him how you're holding up.
Look, ask him how he even knows about the killer. There's nothing in the press.
Ask him about your shop -- the new one.
Ask him about his lawyer,his alibi,his defense. And you? You're coming with me.
Call the guy and ask for more time.
